page.title: 10Bilingual Education.
page.content: This area shows the dramatic growth of bilingual education. The Welsh nursey school Ystum Taf, one of 30 in Cardiff, has 29 pupils compared with 8 when opened in 1972. This school feeds Melin Gruffydd school, one of 4 Welsh primary schools which is now 6 yrs old. They have grown from 60 to 220 pupils during this period. In both schools only approximately 30% of the pupils come from Welsh speaking homes. All pupils go to Glantaf comprehensive. This, the only Welsh secondary school in S. Glamorgan, shows a growth from 99 to 920 pupils in 8 yrs. This year A-level exams are being taken for the first time. Pupils come from all over S. Glam. All subjects are taught through the medium of both Welsh and English.
